com.example.shoutout.db

Class PostsRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.shoutout.db.BaseFirestoreRepository
      • com.example.shoutout.db.PostsRepository

  • public class PostsRepository
extends BaseFirestoreRepository
    Repository for uploading, managing, and retrieving posts from a Firebase Firestore server.
    Since:
    April 29, 2021

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Post> get(java.lang.String id)
        Asynchronously fetch a single post based on its ID
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the post to fetch
        Returns:
        A task containing the post. If the post is null, the ID did not correspond to anything.

      • create

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void> create(java.lang.String parent,
                                                                java.lang.String user,
                                                                java.lang.String text,
                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> images)
        Asynchronously create a new post.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent in which this post belongs to (currently unused, just set it to null)
        user - The ID of the user that uploaded this post
        text - The text body of this post
        images - The paths of the images the user wishes to attach (should be the path retrieved from ImagesRepository.upload(File) or ImagesRepository.upload(Uri).
        Returns:
        A void task

      • getPostsFromUser

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.util.List<Post>> getPostsFromUser(java.lang.String userId,
                                                                                int limit,
                                                                                java.util.Date before)
        Asynchronously fetch a collection of posts from a single user. Posts are ordered by post date (Post.getPosted()) in descending order, so the latest post will be the 0th element. This should be used when building a view of a single user's profile.
        Parameters:
        userId - The ID of the user whose posts to fetch
        limit - The maximum number of posts to fetch
        before - The cutoff point before looking for more posts
        Returns:
        A task of a list of posts. This list will be empty if either 1) the user has not posted anything, or 2) something went wrong during the request.

      • getPostsFromUsers

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.util.List<Post>> getPostsFromUsers(java.util.List<java.lang.String> users,
                                                                                 int limit,
                                                                                 java.util.Date before)
        Asynchronously fetch a collection of posts from several users at once. Posts are ordered by post date (Post.getPosted()) in descending order, so the latest post will be the 0th element. This should be used when building the local user's timeline of posts.
        Parameters:
        users - List of users to fetch posts from
        limit - The maximum number of posts to fetch
        before - The cutoff point before looking for more posts
        Returns:
        A task of a list of points. This list will be empty is either 1) none of the specified user has uploaded anything, or 2) if something went wrong during the request.

      • addLike

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.lang.Boolean> addLike(java.lang.String postId)
        Asynchronously increase the like count of a post by 1.
        Parameters:
        postId - The post ID whose like count should be increased by 1
        Returns:
        A task containing a boolean. This boolean will be true if the request was successful, false otherwise.

      • removeLike

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.lang.Boolean> removeLike(java.lang.String postId)
        Asynchronously decrease the like count of a post by 1.
        Parameters:
        postId - The post ID whose like count should be decreased by 1
        Returns:
        A task containing a boolean. This boolean will be true if the request was successful, false otherwise.

      • fromDbo

        private static Post fromDbo(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot ds)
        Safely convert an instance of DocumentSnapshot into a more dev-friendly Post object.
        Parameters:
        ds - The document snapshot to convert
        Returns:
        A converted object if the conversion was successful, false otherwise

      • fromDbos

        private static java.util.List<Post> fromDbos(com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot qs)
        Safely convert a list of DocumentSnapshot stored in a query.
        Parameters:
        qs - The query snapshot containing the document snapshots to convert
        Returns:
        A list of converted objects. Invalid objects will be kept as null values
        See Also:
        fromDbo(DocumentSnapshot)

        public static PostsRepository getInstance()
        Retrieve a static, permanent, non-null instance of this repository for ease of use
        Returns:
        A permanent instance of this repository
